Name: Systematic evidence evaluation of literature on evidence of biodiversity in UK commercial forests
DisplayUnit: Which of the following most accurately reflects your position?

Fields.Name: Were data aggregated?
Fields.Description: Were the data (for any of intervention/comparator/outcome) aggregated?

Fields.Name: Scale of Study
Fields.Description: What was the scale of the study

Fields.Name: Publication Year
Fields.Description: The year in which the article was published

Fields.Name: Year study started
Fields.Description: Year the study started

Fields.Name: Study Duration (in months)
Fields.Description: How long (in months) was the study

Fields.Name: UK Nation
Fields.Description: Which UK nation was the study in?

Fields.Name: Type of study comparisons made
Fields.Description: What type of comparisons did the study make?

Fields.Name: Commercial Trees
Fields.Description: What commercial tree species were studied

Fields.Column: Stand developmental stages (only if clear cut system system compared)
Fields.Name: Stand developmental stages
Fields.Description: What stage of development were the trees that were studied

Fields.Column: Comparator Site (if a chronosequence, select 'Not applicable')
Fields.Name: Comparator Site
Fields.Description: What type of landuse was the comparator of the study

Fields.Name: Taxonomic Diversity - Richness
Fields.Description: Did the study use Richness as a biodiversity measure?

Fields.Name: Taxonomic Diversity - Abundance
Fields.Description: Did the study use Abundance as a biodiversity measure?

Fields.Name: Taxonomic Diversity - Spp Diversity
Fields.Description: Did the study use Species Richness as a biodiversity measure?

Fields.Name: Community - Composition
Fields.Description: Did the study measure Community Composition?

Fields.Name: Functional Diversity
Fields.Description: Did the study measure Functional Diversity (including diversity of traits)?

Fields.Name: Levels of Redundancy
Fields.Description: Did the study measure Levels of Redundancy (taxonomic and/or functional)?

Fields.Name: Forest Strata of Study
Fields.Description: What strata of the forest was studied?

Fields.Name: Taxonomic groups
Fields.Description: Which taxonomic groups were studied?

Fields.Column: Are missing data fully accounted for?
Fields.Name: Were Missing Data Fully Accounted For?
Fields.Description: If there were any missing data in the study were they accounted for?

Fields.Name: Were all raw data available?
Fields.Description: Did the author make all of their raw data available?
